intro: Asperula elonea, commonly known as the slender woodruff, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Asperula elonea is often found in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
